metadata.notes: The preacher reflects on a 50-year career and a text he previously found too intimidating to preach.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. The sermon is remarkably devoid of 'musts,' shaming, or legalistic demands.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher avoids the role of the moralizing judge. Instead of demanding 'greater works,' he marvels at the possibility of them.
quotes: I, for one, have always fallen back from these words.
I was not about to try to preach that until two weeks ago.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. The preacher acts as a gentle guide through a difficult text.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The Nurturing Parent is present as a 'Wise Elder' who shares his own vulnerability and confusion to comfort the listener.
quotes: supremely consoling and comforting chapter to those who must enter the valley where the dark shadows lie

adult.score_explanation: 10 = Strong Adult presence. The preacher uses logic, arithmetic, and historical context to solve the 'riddle'.
adult.analysis: The preacher engages in a logical deconstruction of the text (contextual analysis) and invites the listener to 'turn over in your mind' the implications. He treats the congregation as thinking subjects.
quotes: The simplest arithmetic will tell one...
Now, this is a mystery that Christ... would be giving his people an even greater good.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. The preacher admits his own past fear of the text, moving toward liberation.
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher does not use fear to motivate. He admits his own 'falling back' from the text, which models transparency rather than rigid adaptation to a 'perfect preacher' persona.
quotes: I have never dared to use as a text.
I was not about to try to preach that until two weeks ago.

free_child_FC.score_explanation: 10 = Authentic, playful, joyful. There is a sense of wonder and imaginative 'play' in the middle of the sermon.
free_child_FC.analysis: The 'Free Child' appears in the imaginative exercise regarding Jerusalem and the airplanes, and in the rhythmic, hopeful crescendo at the end.
quotes: Every airplane would be thronged with Christian pilgrims...
The most moving music has not been sung...

ego_positions_scan.dominant_ego_position: Adult (processing the Riddle) transitioning to Nurturing Parent (offering the solution).

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher shares his intellectual journey. By admitting he didn't understand the text for 50 years, he levels the playing field, inviting the listener's Adult to join his Adult in solving the puzzle.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: Minimal. The preacher is transparent about his previous struggle with the text.
transaction_analysis.purity_explanation: 10 = Completely transparent. The sermon is highly pure; the 'Social' message (solving a riddle) matches the 'Psychological' message (encouragement).
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The only slight risk is a 'Bait & Switch' where the 'greater works' could be turned into a burden, but the preacher avoids this by attributing the power to Christ's ascension rather than human effort.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: The preacher avoids ITHY (I'm Only Trying To Help You) by not offering a 'cheap' fix. He avoids NIGYSOB by not blaming the congregation for not doing 'greater works.' He maintains authenticity by being a 'fellow traveler' through the riddle.

preacher_roles.rescuer: Low; he points to Christ as the one who does the work rather than himself as the expert.
preacher_roles.persecutor: Absent; no blaming of the congregation's lack of faith.
preacher_roles.victim: Low; he briefly mentions his own inability to preach the text, but not in a 'poor me' way.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: The congregation is invited into the role of 'Successors' or 'Witnesses' rather than Victims of the world.
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon promotes autonomy by suggesting that the power is available to 'people like you and me' because of a theological reality (the Ascension), not because of the preacher's intervention.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: This sermon is an exemplary model of psychologically healthy homiletics. It avoids the common trap of the Critical Parent (demanding 'greater works' as a law) and instead uses the Adult ego state to investigate a theological difficulty. By being vulnerable about his own 50-year struggle with the text, the preacher eliminates the power imbalance often found in the pulpit. The conclusion moves into a hopeful Free Child/Nurturing Parent space that inspires rather than coerces.
strengths: High level of transparency and vulnerability.
Strong Adult-to-Adult engagement through logical inquiry.
areas_for_improvement: The imaginative scenario about Jerusalem is effective but could lean toward 'Ain't it Awful' if the focus stayed on the difficulty of travel; however, he uses it well to prove a point.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Continue to use the 'I-position' (sharing personal struggle) as it successfully prevents the 'Preacher-as-Persecutor' dynamic.
